brief_summary.textblock:
Non-intubated thoracoscopic surgery has been proved as an adequate alternative for
      management of many lung conditions such as pneumothorax , lung volume reduction, pulmonary
      metastasectomy, removal of lung nodules, segmentectomy and lobectomy. However, the
      hemodynamic changes during one lung ventilation have not been fully investigated. The goals
      of this study are to compare the changes of hemodynamics (including blood pressure, heart
      rate, cardiac output, pulse pressure variation, fluid responsiveness) and cerebral oximetry
      during one lung ventilation between conventional intubated and non-intubated vedio-assisted
      thoracoscopic (VATS) operations.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hemodynamic Changes During One Lung Ventilation in Non-intubated Vedio-assisted Thoracoscopic Operations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

          1. age over 20 y/o, less than 70 y/o

          2. schedured to receive VATS operations with OLV

        Exclusion:

          1. previous thoracic surgery

          2. cardiac disease ( including arrhythmias, congestive heart failure, coronary cardiac
             disease, etc.)

          3. pulmonary disease

study_pop.textblock:
patients schedured to receive vedio-assisted thoracoscopic (VATS) operations with one lung
        ventilation(OLV)

intervention.description: fluid infusion by 10 mL/kg after one lung ventilation

clinical_study.official_title: Hemodynamic Changes and Fluid Responsiveness During One Lung Ventilation: Comparison in Non-intubated and Intubated Vedio-assisted Thoracoscopic Operations

overall_official.affiliation: department of anesthesiology, national taiwan university hospital

primary_outcome.description: record the stroke volume and cardiac output during two lung ventilation till 15 minutes after one lung ventilation
primary_outcome.measure: cardiac output after one lung ventilation

primary_outcome.description: blood pressure before and after one lung ventilation

primary_outcome.measure: changes of cerebral oximeter after one lung ventilation

primary_outcome.description: SVV / PPV before and after fluid infusion
primary_outcome.measure: stroke volume variation / pulse pressure variation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
